page.title: 18VILLAGE NEAR DARLINGTON
page.content: The land at Blackwell Village used to be farmers land.They used it for their crops or to keep their animals in. Blackwell Grange was once a large mansion, belonging to a rich man named George Allan, in the 1600's.It is now a hotel. Some houses date back to the 1800's and were once stables and haylofts. Two shops near there were built in the 1930's and they are a food shop and a newsagents and a post-office. From there more than 1,000 people have things delivered to them weekly. Around Grangeside some houses are very recent and have only just been moved into. We interviewed some one whose house was only fifteen years old. These houses are mostly link-detached and quite large. Also some are semi-detached.
